ygData.subject: RE: Z-axis bug
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree that it is most likely a bug but mentioned the possibility of it being a feature just in case. One other thing I forgot to mention is that I have only
ygData.messageBody:
I agree that it is most likely a bug but mentioned the possibility of it
being a feature just in case.

One other thing I forgot to mention is that I have only noticed this bug
when singing Denon's Disruptive Discord. When I sing the Lullaby or Largo's
Melodic Binding in Unrest, they only seem to affect the creatures nearby and
fortunately not the hag in the basement. Is this because the area of effect
for these two songs is smaller than Denon's and thus not reaching the hag?

Galtin of E'ci
> >
> > Before we submit a petition, I think we should also consider the
> possibility
> > that this is not even a bug. I say that because it is within the realms
> of
> > possibility that Verant intended for our songs to work this way. Sound
> does
> > carry so its possible that even though we can't see the monsters, they
> can
> > certainly hear our songs through the walls. Something to consider.
>
> If that's the case, why do we need visual sight of a mob to target them
> with bellow and chains? As they are sound, line of sight should be
> irrelevant, no? Anyway, I would say this is a bug, or more likely a
> design flaw. The recent discussion on the charismatic carillon shows
> that there are other problems with the z axis that they haven't fixed
> either.
>
>
>
